alert.note: Alert for Knox; Pierce (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 4:00PM CST until December 15 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR CENTRAL WAYNE...NORTHEASTERN PIERCE...EAST CENTRAL KNOX AND CEDAR COUNTIES... At 400 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles west of Hartington to Wakefield, moving northeast at 85 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Wynot around 410 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include St. Helena, St. Helena Boat Dock, Fordyce, Obert, Belden, Magnet, Pleasant Valley, Laurel, Brooky Bottom and Camp Assurance. HAIL...0.75IN WIND...70MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northeastern Nebraska.
